title: Datasworn data entry
description: Data entry schema for Datasworn, which provides templates and other conveniences like source inheritance. It must be processed into the standard Datasworn format.

Color.title: Color
Color.description: A CSS hex color. Use it to provide thematic accents when rendering this item.

Icon.title: Icon
Icon.description: A relative URI pointing to an SVG icon.

Image.title: Image
Image.description: A relative URI pointing to a WEBP image.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: Metadata describing the source of this item's text content

title.description: The title of the source document.

page.description: The page number on which this item appears most prominently, if applicable.

uri.description: The URI where the source document is available.

date.description: The date of the source documents's last update, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. Important because it's used to determine whether the data needs updating.

license.description: An absolute URI pointing to the location where this element's license can be found. If it's "null", no license is provided -- use with caution.

Label.title: Label
Label.description: A localized plain text name or label.

MarkdownParagraph.title: MarkdownParagraph
MarkdownParagraph.description: Localized markdown text, usually one paragraph. This may included ordered or unordered lists.

MarkdownParagraphs.title: MarkdownParagraphs
MarkdownParagraphs.description: Localized markdown text, usually multiple paragraphs. This may include ordered or unordered lists.

MarkdownPhrase.title: MarkdownPhrase
MarkdownPhrase.description: Localized markdown text, usually a phrase or single sentence.

MarkdownSentences.title: MarkdownSentences
MarkdownSentences.description: Localized markdown text, usually a few sentences at most.

ProgressTypeClassic.title: ProgressTypeClassic
ProgressTypeClassic.description: Standard progress track types found in Ironsworn or Ironsworn: Delve

content_type.description: 'range' displays the number range. 'result', 'summary', and 'description' display the string value from the OracleTableRow's corresponding key.

table_key.description: A key from OracleCollection#contents, indicating which OracleTable's data is used in this column.

match.title: Oracle match behavior
match.description: A handful of oracles have special behavior on a match.

content_type.description: 'range' displays the number range. 'result', 'summary', and 'description' display the string value from the OracleTableRow's corresponding key.

style.description:
The style used to render this table in the source material.

        * embed_as_column: This table appears as a column of a table handled by its OracleCollection parent.
        * embed_in_row: This table appears in its entirety within the row of another table. Canonical examples appear in the Ironsworn Rulebook and Ironsworn: Delve.
        * table: A standard table, typically with a roll column and a result column.

times.description: The number of times to roll.

method.title: Oracle roll method
method.description:
no_duplicates = Reroll duplicate OracleTableRows
      allow_duplicates = Don't reroll duplicate OracleTableRows
      make_it_worse = Don't reroll duplicate OracleTableRows; duplicates compound

OracleTableRow.title: OracleTableRow
OracleTableRow.description: Represents a row from an oracle table.

low.description: The low end of this row's roll range

high.description: The high end of this row's roll range

summary.description:
A secondary markdown string that must be presented to the user for the implementation to be complete, but may benefit from progressive disclosure (such as a collapsible element, popover/tooltip, etc).

`null` is used in cases where an 'empty' `OracleTableRow.summary` exists (example: Starship Type, p. 326). In the book, these table cells are rendered with the text `--` (and this is the recommended placeholder for tabular display). For display as a single result (e.g. VTT roll output), however, `null` values can be safely omitted.

embed_table.description: A table to be rendered inside this table row.

ConditionMeterID.title: ConditionMeterID
ConditionMeterID.description: ID for a standard player character condition meter.

StatID.title: StatID
StatID.description: ID for a standard player character stat.

EncounterClassic.title: EncounterClassic
EncounterClassic.description: An encounter entry similar to those in Chapter 5 of classic Ironsworn.

quest_starter.description: A localizable markdown string describing the quest starter associated with this item.

asset.description: The ID of the parent Asset of the move, if any.

progress_move.description: Whether or not the move is a Progress Move. Progress moves roll two challenge dice against a progress score.

variant_of.description: The ID of the move that this move is a variant of, if any.

oracles.description: The ID of any oracles directly referenced by the move, or vice versa.

optional.description: Whether or not the source material presents this rules item as optional.

tags.description: Arbitrary strings tags that describe optional metadata that doesn't fit in other properties.

category.description: The ID of the move's category.

contents.description: The AssetClassics contained by this collection.
The EncounterClassics contained by this collection.
The MoveClassics contained by this collection.
The OracleTables contained by this collection.

rendering.definition: Some oracle collections are rendered as a single table in the source material. If so, parameters for rendering that table are included here.

^[a-z][a-z_]*[a-z]$.description: A column's default label is the title of the source table.

RegionEntry.title: RegionEntry
RegionEntry.description: A region entry, like the Ironlands region entries found in classic Ironsworn.

Rarity.title: Rarity
Rarity.description: A rarity, like those presented in Ironsworn: Delve.

asset.description: The asset enhanced by this rarity.

xp_cost.description:
From Ironsworn: Delve, p. 174:

    Some assets will bring a rarity into play more often than others, so the experience point cost for a rarity will vary by the linked asset. These costs are shown in the tables on page 175.

    If you are playing solo, and arenâ€™t concerned with the relative balance of rarity abilities, you can ignore these variable costs. If so, spend 3 experience points to purchase a rarity.

DelveSite.title: DelveSite
DelveSite.description: A delve site with a theme, domain, and denizen table.

DelveSiteCardBase.title: DelveSiteCardBase
DelveSiteCardBase.description: Schema shared by delve site themes and delve site domains.

DelveSiteDenizen.title: DelveSiteDenizen
DelveSiteDenizen.description: A denizen entry in a delve site.

result.const: You transition into a new theme
You transition into a new domain

Suggestions.title: Suggestions
Suggestions.description: Related items that can be presented as useful shortcuts.

SourcePartial.description: A source data stub that inherits data from ancestor elements during post-processing.

title.description: The title of the source document.

page.description: The page number on which this item appears most prominently, if applicable.

uri.description: The URI where the source document is available.

date.description: The date of the source documents's last update, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. Important because it's used to determine whether the data needs updating.

license.description: An absolute URI pointing to the location where this element's license can be found. If it's "null", no license is provided -- use with caution.

_source.description: Source information to be inherited by all eligible descendants. Descendant '_source' properties will override only the properties they specify; use the 'source' property if you'd prefer to replace the entire object.
